question: Who has been new Prime Minister of Kyrgyzstan?
explanation: Kyrgyzstan's Parliament has named Mukhammedkaliy Abylgaziyev as the new Prime Minister. Abylgaziyev, previously chief of staff in President Sooronbai Jeenbekov's office, replaced Sapar Isakov whose cabinet lost a no-confidence vote. The govt reshuffle completes a series of moves taken by Jeenbekov since he came to power to remove the appointees of his predecessor, Almazbek Atambayev.
